intro: Guatteria geminiflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Marcaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green leaves that are often clustered at the base of the plant. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in pairs along the stems. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellow berry that contains several seeds. Guatteria geminiflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
